subTitle:
Hint: GPX-routes without elevation data should be converted to tracks with www.gpsvisualizer.com.
						Trackdata without elevation will be skipped on demand. Tracksegments will be combined. Routes and waypoints will be ignored. Trackname will be set to filename.
						Button Save GPX-File underneath will save settings and / or GPX-File.

param0.label: path_to_gpx_files_2
param0.description: Define path without leading and trailing slashes
param0.info: Path to file(s) with GPX-Track(s) relative to the Wordpress uploads folder, e.g: ../wordpress/wp-content/uploads/gpx

param1.label: gpxfile
param1.description: GPX-File : Combine Route(s) and Track(s), Reduce with Settings below and add Track Statistics (Track length and Elevation gain and loss).
param1.info: Used for uploading only. Define the file in your shortcode, too!. File with gpx-track, e.g: ../wordpress/wp-content/uploads/gpx/test.gpx. Use comma seperated list for multiple file: "f1.gpx, f2.gpx, f3.gpx"

param2.label: gpx_reduce
param2.description: GPX-File :  Combine Route(s) and Track(s), Reduce with Settings below and add Track Statistics (Track length and Elevation gain and loss).

param5.label: gpx_ignore_zero_elev
param5.text: Ignore Track Points with Zero Elevation.
param5.description: Upload GPX-File : Ignore Track Points with Zero Elevation. Necessary for some devices, because they write "0" as Elevation Data if GPX accuracy is not sufficient
param5.info: Ignore Track Points with Zero Elevation in Chart. Necessary for some devices, because they write "0" as Elevation Data if GPX accuracy is not sufficient

param3.label: gpx_smooth
param3.description: Min. Distance of Track Points in Meters (25m best for mountaineering of any kind)

param4.label: gpx_elesmooth
param4.description: Min. Elevation between Track Points in Meters. Used for Statistics Calc only. Best is 4.
